solution_line_template: In class A, there are {class_a_percentage} * {total_students} = <<{class_a_percentage}*{total_students}={students_in_class_a}>>{students_in_class_a} students.

In class B, the number of students is less by {fewer_students_class_b}, which means class B has {students_in_class_a} - {fewer_students_class_b} = <<{students_in_class_a}-{fewer_students_class_b}={students_in_class_b}>>{students_in_class_b} students.

That means {total_students} - {students_in_class_a} - {students_in_class_b} = <<{total_students}-{students_in_class_a}-{students_in_class_b}={students_in_class_c}>>{students_in_class_c} students are in class C.
